sentences: Tema sõnadest kõlas alp enesekiitus. Rahvasuu ütleb, et enesekiitus haiseb.
See lill haiseb halvasti pärast vihma.
Kodu haiseb väga hästi pärast koristamist.
context: The word 'haiseb' is the third person singular present form of the Estonian verb 'haisma', which means 'to smell'. When something 'haiseb', it has an unpleasant or bad odor. The dictionary example shows that when someone engages in self-praise (enesekiitus), it is said to 'haiseb' - meaning it smells bad, implying that excessive self-praise is distasteful and off-putting, much like a bad smell.
